intro: Ouratea integrifolia, commonly known as the white sand tree or Brazilian sand tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white, clustered flowers that are often followed by bright red berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions as a decorative plant.
